description: A series of high-profile arrests took place in the last week of March, targeting high-ranking officials from the Ministry of Economic Development, Rosaviation, Rosatom, and the Federal Customs Service. The accused are charged with corruption schemes and abuse of power.
original:
A wave of high-profile arrests: are there no more untouchables? The last week of March was marked by a series of high-profile arrests. FSB officers came for high-ranking officials from the Ministry of Economic Development, Rosaviation, Rosatom, and the Federal Customs Service (FCS). All are accused of corruption schemes, as well as abuse of power.

The scientific director of the Institute of Regional Problems, political scientist Dmitry Zhuravlev, saw in a series of arrests a manifestation of political will. “Corruption was not at all afraid of the SVO. The hope that increased control rigidity, inevitable in the conditions of a military operation, did not justify itself. At least so far there has been no quality victory. However, the arrests we are hearing about show that the struggle is ongoing. For example, our colonel-generals are detained and arrested extremely rarely,” Dmitry Zhuravlev told Paragraph. He did not rule out consequences for the leaders of the detainees - as a result of the investigation, new corruption connections may become clear. “Those who were in charge will also be called to account . They will ask: “Where did you guys look that you could have something like this?” This will be followed by liability (not necessarily criminal) and certain conclusions regarding higher management,” the expert is confident. Read more about the series of March arrests of high-ranking officials in our material. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

description: Former Russian military officer Maxim Kuzminov, who had transported a helicopter to Ukraine, was killed in Spain. He was shot with a 9-mm Makarov pistol and ran over by a car. The shell casings found at the crime scene are believed to be important evidence pointing to the identity of the perpetrators.
original:
The New York Times told how former Russian military officer Maxim Kuzminov, who had transported a helicopter to Ukraine, was killed in Spain. He was shot with a Makarov pistol and ran over by a car. Two suspects in the murder of Russian military pilot Maxim Kuzminov left cartridges from 9-mm Makarov pistol cartridges at the crime scene. This was reported by The New York Times in a large article on the murder, citing Spanish investigators.

The newspaper called the shell casings important evidence pointing to the identity of the perpetrators because the cartridges are standard ammunition in countries of the former communist bloc.

What else did The New York Times journalists find out about the murder of the former Russian military man:

✹ Kuzminov left Ukraine in October 2023, shortly after ferrying a helicopter from Russia. In Spain, he settled in the city of La Villajoyosa on the Mediterranean coast, where Russian organized crime groups operate.

✹ Probably, the killers found Kuzminov after he wrote to his ex-girlfriend and invited her to come to him in Spain. “This was a serious mistake,” said one Ukrainian official who also spoke to the publication.

✹ Having killed the pilot, the criminals ran over his body in a stolen car. The criminals' car was found several kilometers from the scene of the incident. She was burned using special means, investigators believe.

Other details are retold from The New York Times material at the link.

description: Sergei Napalkov died after a long delay of the Bangkok-Krasnoyarsk plane. Despite his deteriorating condition, Aeroflot representatives only offered assistance when it was too late. The airline's offers came after Sergei spent three days in the hospital and several hours on the plane.
original:
“A representative of Aeroflot in Bangkok came when my husband was almost dead” The wife of a man who died after a long delay of the Bangkok-Krasnoyarsk plane told Izvestia about the actions of the airline. According to her, an Aeroflot representative said that they were “monitoring the situation” and called the Bangkok hospital, where they were allegedly told that “the passenger is recovering.” However, according to Natalya Napalkova, no one could give them such information. “Then he began working with the hospital administration about my debt, later SMS messages came from insurance companies that they had also joined in and were ready to pay some part. Representative of Aeroflot “He said that they would pay the rest themselves,” the widow said. Offers from the airline began to pour in when it was already too late - Sergei Napalkov was dying after several hours spent on a stuffy plane. Before that, he spent three days in the hospital, but no one wanted to help him.

Natalya emphasizes that people all over Russia found her contacts. At the same time, Aeroflot, having the woman’s direct phone number, “could not” find the passenger. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Czech counter-intelligence, with the help of the SBU, exposed a pro-Russian network of influence on MEPs in Prague, led by Putin's close associate Medvedchuk. The network bribed politicians to promote Russia and Putin in European media and published anti-Ukrainian and anti-European content on its website.
original:
On the eve of the June elections to the European Parliament, Czech counter-intelligence exposed a pro-Russian network of influence on MEPs in Prague, behind which was Putin's best man Medvedchuk, writes the publication "Voice of America". But, according to the information of officers of the Ukrainian intelligence community, it was possible to expose this network thanks to the help of the SBU.

The network paid politicians money to praise Russia and Putin in the European media, as well as published anti-Ukrainian and anti-European materials on its own website "Voice of Europe". The goal is to bring as many pro-Russian politicians into the European Parliament as possible.

Medvedchuk launched the "Voice of Europe" website together with the former general producer of the "112 Ukraine" TV channel Artem Marchevsky.

Putin's European political fan club has suffered a serious blow, because now many MEPs are demanding a thorough investigation of Russian influence and punishment for "colleagues" who embezzled Russian money.Voice of America In the European Parliament, they are demanding an investigation into the Russian network of influence, which was probably headed by Medvedchuk. the investigation into reports of the disclosure of a network of Russian influence on European politicians, for example...

description: After intense battles, Russian troops entered Paris on March 31, 1814, marking the end of a two-year war between the Russian Empire and Napoleon's French Empire. The French Empire capitulated, and Emperor Alexander I led a triumphant cavalry procession through the city.
original:
ON MARCH 31, 1814, RUSSIAN TROOPS ENTERED PARIS

After intense battles on the approaches to the French capital, after Russian artillerymen occupied the commanding heights, contrary to the will of Napoleon, the French Empire capitulated. The capitulation of Paris was signed at 2 a.m. on March 31 in the village of Lavillette on the terms drawn up by the dashing Colonel Mikhail Orlov, who was left hostage by the French during the truce. Thus ended a two-year war in which Napoleon’s empire could not withstand the confrontation with the Russian Empire.

At noon on March 31, cavalry squadrons led by Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered the capital of France. “All the streets along which the allies had to pass, and all the streets adjacent to them, were filled with people who occupied even the roofs of the houses,” recalled the hero of the day, Mikhail Orlov.

Vengefulness is the lot of the weak. True winners are characterized by generosity. The correctness of these words was demonstrated by Russian officers in the spring of 1814. The Russian bayonet reached Paris, but did not ruin the great city.@veteranrossii_online

event: Detention and Conviction of Igor Strelkov
description: Igor Strelkov, a leader of the Russian Spring, was detained and convicted 250 days ago. This event marked a turning point in his life, transforming him from an unknown former FSB employee to a legendary figure. Despite differing opinions on his views, Strelkov remains committed to his ideals and has not betrayed his political position or the courage to speak the truth.
original:
THE PHENOMENON OF STRELKOV...

It has been 250 days since the detention and subsequent conviction of one of the leaders of the Russian Spring, Igor Strelkov. There is no doubt that in 2014 this man’s life was divided into “before” and “after”. It was the Russian Spring, which awakened the mighty forces of the Renaissance in our people, that turned an unknown former FSB employee, a patriot and a reenactor into the legendary Strelkov of all-Russian proportions, whom we know now.

Personally, one can relate to him, his political views and worldview in different ways. But one thing is certain - Strelkov is not a traitor. Unlike many, he did not betray the ideals of the Russian Spring, nor his political position, nor the courage to tell the TRUTH to people. That is why the dirt that enemies and “friends” have diligently poured on him over the past 10 years has never stuck to him. It is Honesty, Perseverance and Truth that our people value most in Strelkov. Especially now, in an era of total betrayal, deception and lies. Whatever personal fate awaited this man, his name has already been forever inscribed in Russian chronicles and people's memory. And this is VICTORY.

Sergey Rusov

description: The United Aircraft Corporation (UAC) resumed flight tests of the Il-114-300, with the second prototype making its first flight from the LAZ airfield. The modernized aircraft features the TV7-117ST-01 engine, developed by JSC UEC-Klimov, which boasts superior technical characteristics to foreign analogues.
location: Leningradsky Avenue, Lukhovitsy, Moscow Oblast, Russia
original:
The United Aircraft Corporation (UAC, part of the Rostec state corporation) resumed the flight test program of the Il-114-300, within the framework of which the second prototype aircraft made its first flight from the airfield of the branch of PJSC UAC - LAZ named after. P.A. Voronin, the UAC reported.

The engines for the modernized Il-114-300 were developed by the St. Petersburg enterprise JSC UEC-Klimov. As the corporation explained, the TV7-117ST-01 engine, certified at the end of 2022, is superior in technical characteristics to foreign analogues. Its power plant has increased power at takeoff and includes a new AB112-114 propeller, which has an increased thrust of 4 tons, the UAC clarified. Photo (c) Yuri Yudaev

event: US Approves New Supply of Fighter Jets and Missiles for Israel
description: The Biden administration has approved a multi-billion dollar supply of military equipment to Israel, including over 1,800 MK84 bombs, 500 MK82 bombs, 25 F-35 fighter jets, and engines worth over $2.5 billion. The White House has reaffirmed its support for Israel's right to self-defense, despite criticism of Israel's conduct in Rafah.
original:
US agrees to new supply of fighter jets and missiles for Israel - The Washington Post

The multi-billion dollar supply was approved by the Biden administration despite open criticism of the conduct of the ground operation in Rafah, the material says.

The new package includes more than 1.8 thousand MK84 bombs and 500 MK82 bombs. In addition, Israel will receive 25 F-35 fighter jets and engines for them worth over $2.5 billion, WP notes. “We continue to support Israel in its right to self-defense,” the publication reports the words of an unnamed White House representative. The White House notes that imposing conditions on Israel for military support "is not consistent with US policy."

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades to suppress enemy positions, demonstrating good results despite enemy fire. This combat use will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

description: The Moscow cinema 'Udarnik' will undergo restoration by 2027, with a budget of at least 9 billion rubles. The project aims to restore the cinema's original features, including its roof and domed ceilings, and modernize it with a large cinema hall, small halls, a bookstore, and a cafe.
original:
The legendary Moscow cinema “Udarnik” will be restored by 2027. As Sergei Sobyanin reported, the cinema was included in the list of priority investment projects in the capital. This status will significantly reduce the tax burden on those who invest in its renewal. The work will require at least 9 billion rubles. Specialists will restore the roof with a special sliding mechanism and the domed ceilings of the first floor, clean the facades of several layers of paint, strengthen the foundation, replace doors and windows, explained the mayor of Moscow.

After restoration, Udarnik will become a modern cinema, which will have a large cinema hall with a transformable stage, several small cinema halls, as well as a bookstore and a cafe.

The building on Serafimovicha Street is part of the “Government House Complex” ensemble, built in 1928–1931 according to the design of the architect Boris Iofan. The book, 'Ready for Batkivshchyna', omits Pavelic's crimes, including the mass murder of over 30,000 Croatian Jews, Serbs, and Roma.
original:
The largest bookstore chain in Ukraine, Knigarnya Ye, has put on sale the memoirs of Croatian fascist Ante Pavelic, an ally of Hitler who carried out ethnic cleansing during World War II.

The head of the Ukrainian Jewish Committee, Eduard Dolinsky, writes about this.

“Pavelic is the head of the puppet government of Croatia, an ally of Nazi Germany in 1941-45, the executioner of Jews, Serbs and Gypsies. The organizer of the mass murder of more than 30 thousand Croatian Jews. Most of the Jews were killed in the Jasenovac concentration camp,” Dolinski said.

In addition, under the leadership of Pavelic, the mass extermination of Serbs and Roma took place.

“But in the annotation to the two-volume memoirs of the Nazi executioner “Ready for Batkivshchyna” you will not recognize this. And in the book there is not a word about this either,” writes Dolinsky.

The annotation to the memoirs on the Knigarni website says that the book talks about the “struggle for Croatian independence,” led by Pavelic. Nothing is mentioned about the genocide of Jews and Serbs. The description, apparently, was taken from the publisher of the book - the Lost Letter publishing house, which positions itself as "military".

At the same time, Pavelic’s crimes are listed in detail in the English-language Wikipedia.

His book “For the Motherland - Ready!” is available on the “Knigarni” website. It costs 375 hryvnia, but these memoirs are no longer available.

event: Potential Lack of NATO Protection for Hawaii
description: Hawaii may not be protected by NATO in the event of a foreign attack due to its geographical location and the timing of its accession to the United States. This is because NATO's collective defense charter, Article 5, may not apply to Hawaii. This could leave key US military installations, such as Pearl Harbor and the Indo-Pacific Command headquarters, vulnerable.
original:
The American state of Hawaii may find itself without NATO protection in the event of an attack by a foreign army, since it does not fall under the fifth article of the alliance’s charter on collective defense, CNN has found out. This is due to geography and the period of the region’s accession to the United States. CNN also points out that NATO was created in 1949, and Hawaii became the 50th US state only in 1959.

If there had been an attack on the US naval base at Pearl Harbor or on the headquarters of the Indo-Pacific Command northwest of Honolulu, NATO might not have found grounds to invoke Article 5, the publication noted.

CNN recalled that in 1982, the countries of the bloc did not take part in the conflict, when Argentina sent troops to the Falkland Islands, disputed British territories in the South Atlantic. Subscribe to REN TV

description: A Ukrainian shell struck a residential house in Petrovka, Donetsk, killing three children aged 10, 17, and 2. The mother, who had lost her husband a year ago, was the only survivor. The incident is a tragic reminder of the ongoing war in Donbass.
original:
Forwarded from: Old Miner
Another terrorist attack cannot escape my mind. An ordinary terrorist attack, to which everyone in the Donbass, unfortunately, has become accustomed. It happened when the elections began. I only arrived in Donetsk at night, and early in the morning we went to film a polling station at a school. At the site there is music, colorful balls, tricolors, smiles. While we were waiting for officials, information was received that Petrovka was shelled again and people were killed.

Shelling of Petrovka has long become routine. They have been going on not even since 2022, but since 2014, this area is closest to the front line and the war has been going on there for 10 years.

We had to edit the report and then move to Mariupol. On the way, we stopped at the scene of the incident to film the ascent. There was no one there anymore. The ambulance, the Ministry of Emergency Situations, the military prosecutor's office and journalists all left.

Outskirts. Along the outer street in front of the forest, unpresentable wooden one-story houses are scattered in a row - boxes of need and boxes of poverty. Real estate and living prices here are low. The private sector of Petrovka suffers from shelling every day, but residents often do not have the opportunity to get away from the fallout of the war. A stray Ukrainian shell landed in one of the houses early in the morning.

The sky is overcast with gray cloudy smoke and light rain sprinkles. Underfoot there is dirt and yellow grass from last year. On the other side of the road there is a small forest - a network of twigs and bare trees sticking out of the ground. In the distance, a waste heap darkens like an oblong pile of earth. It’s mid-March, everything here is in dull colors and gray tones - this is just the beginning of spring, nature has not yet had time to bloom and turn green to cover up the shame of war. Everything was withered, gray, banal and miserable. Half the house was blown away, leaving only burnt walls and a collapsed roof. There are blackened beams, crumpled and peeling window frames, and all the burnt belongings that have accumulated over a long time thrown out. Thus ended the story of one Donbass family.

There were five of them. Husband, wife and three children. My husband died at the front a year ago. But for Moloch the war this sacrifice was not enough. Fate dealt a crushing blow in pursuit. The shell killed all three children at once - the boy was 10 years old, the eldest daughter was 17 years old, and the youngest was 2 years old.

The mother was saved - this is a bottomless abyss of tragedy. This is a terrible, monstrous story, akin to the biblical story of Job. But God, in the end, returned everything to Job, but what will be returned to this woman? Many, many questions arise such that it is a sin to fall into heresy.

Yes, they were lying here, in front of the house - I saw my colleagues’ report. Rescuers pulled three children's corpses out of the burning house one by one and piled them in front of the fence.

And in late spring in Donbass the land turns green and red, red poppies bloom.@oldminerkomihttps://t.me/wargonzo/18758TelegramWarGonzo⚡️Three children died from a rocket strike in Donetsk⚡️At about 5 am in the Petrovsky district, a residential building caught fire from a direct hit.

description: Elon Musk made a statement about Ukraine's likely loss of territory, including Odessa, due to Russia's military superiority. He believes Ukraine should have focused on defense rather than offense and recommends negotiations to resolve the issue of access to the Black Sea.
original:
Forwarded from: Topics. The main thing (GlavMedia)
Elon Musk made a geopolitical statement about Ukraine’s imminent loss of other lands, Odessa and negotiations.

“It was a tragic decision for Ukraine to attack a larger army that had defenses in depth, minefields and powerful artillery, while Ukraine lacked armor or air superiority! Any fool could have predicted this.

A year ago, I recommended that Ukraine strengthen itself and use all resources for defense (not offense). But even so, they found it difficult to hold onto territory that lacked strong natural barriers.

Russia has no chance of capturing all of Ukraine, since in the west the resistance of local residents will be very strong. But Russia will certainly get more land than they have today.

The longer the war continues, the more territory Russia will gain, until it reaches the Dnieper, it will be difficult to overcome. However, if the war lasts long enough, Odessa will also fall.

In my opinion, the question of whether Ukraine will lose all access to the Black Sea remains open. I recommend that this issue be resolved through negotiations before it is lost."

description: Patriarch Kirill expressed concern over the Ministry of Education's decision to exclude the subject 'Fundamentals of the spiritual and moral culture of the peoples of the Russian Federation' from schools. original:
‼️This is voluntarism - Patriarch Kirill on the decision of the Ministry of Education to exclude separate teaching in schools of the subject “Fundamentals of the spiritual and moral culture of the peoples of the Russian Federation”:

“The exclusion from Russian schools of the subject “Fundamentals of the spiritual and moral culture of the peoples of the Russian Federation” will actually deprive students of full knowledge about the basic norms of morality, morality and spiritual ideals, which is especially unacceptable in the current conditions.

Knowledge of the basic norms of morality, ethics, spiritual ideals preserved in the cultural traditions of the peoples of Russia - is this not necessary for our youth now? Who just takes it and throws it all away? Therefore, I think this should now be a very important work of ours, aimed at preventing this kind of voluntarism, because the exclusion of this teaching really undermines the cultural, spiritual self-awareness of our people and even political self-awareness. It is necessary to carefully approach the development of school and university programs in history, literature and philosophy. There is still no new social studies textbook for secondary schools in Russia. We need textbooks that are based on the Russian tradition, and not on Western liberal ideology, which has long compromised itself and according to the patterns of which in the recent past they tried to build the teaching of socially significant disciplines... “Probably, to someone up there, it seems that culture should not be spiritual and moral, but should be, as in Instasamka’s song “YES FOR MONEY.”

description: Russian pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked an Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, was assassinated in Spain. Two men, believed to be professionals, shot him six times and ran over his body with a car. The investigation is ongoing, with shell casings from 9-mm Makarov pistol cartridges serving as a clue to the killers' identity.
original:
The perpetrators of the murder of Russian pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked an Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, shot him six times and then ran over his body with a car, The New York Times writes, citing sources in the Spanish Civil Guard. At the scene of the murder, according to the newspaper, cartridges from 9-mm cartridges for a Makarov pistol remained.

Investigators say the shell casings are a clue to the identity of the killers: they are standard ammunition from the former communist bloc.

"This was a clear signal," said a senior official of the Guardia Civil, the Spanish police force overseeing the murder investigation. “I will find you, I will kill you, I will crush you and humiliate you.”

According to the NYT, on February 13, a white Hyundai Tucson drove into the garage under the house where Maxim Kuzminov lived. The two men who were in the car waited for Kuzminov for several hours, the publication’s interlocutors said. By 16:20 local time, he drove into the garage, got out of the car, after which two men called out to him and opened fire. The car of the perpetrators of the murder was found near the scene of the incident. According to investigators, it was stolen.

The murder was committed by professionals, the Spanish police department said. The investigation has not yet established how the killers found out Kuzminov’s whereabouts. However, according to senior Ukrainian officials, shortly before his death, Maxim Kuzminov contacted his ex-girlfriend, who was in Russia, and invited her to Spain.

NYT's interlocutors called his action a serious mistake.

At the same time, Maxim Kuzminov led an “immodest life” in Spain, drove an S-Class Mercedes, and visited bars.

According to the publication, he received half a million dollars for hijacking a helicopter. “Actually, we announced all this information immediately after the liquidation of the scumbag! Subscribe to the Ramzai channel and you will be the first to know everything!) Telegram RamzaiVIEW MESSAGE

event: Exposure of Pro-Russian Network of Influence

The network bribed politicians to promote Russia and Putin in European media and published anti-Ukrainian and anti-European materials on its 'Voice of Europe' website, aiming to bring pro-Russian politicians into the European Parliament.
original:
Bribed MEPs and disinformation: Medvedchuk's powerful network of influence was exposed in the EU On the eve of the June elections to the European Parliament, Czech counter-intelligence uncovered a pro-Russian network of influence on MEPs in Prague, behind which Putin's godfather Medvedchuk was behind, Voice of America writes.

According to our sources, this network was exposed thanks to the help of the SBU.

Among other things, the network paid politicians to praise Russia and Putin in the European media, as well as published anti-Ukrainian and anti-European materials on its own "Voice of Europe" website. The goal is to bring as many pro-Russian politicians into the European Parliament as possible.

Medvedchuk launched the "Voice of Europe" website together with the former general producer of the "112 Ukraine" TV channel Artem Marchevsky.

Putin's European political fan club suffered a serious blow, because now many MEPs are demanding a thorough investigation into Russian influence and punishment for "colleagues" who embezzled Russian money.

description: On the night of March 31, 2024, Ukraine's Air Force, mobile fire groups, and radio-electronic warfare equipment repelled an air attack by Russian invaders. Ukrainian forces destroyed 18 aerial targets, including 9 cruise missiles and 9 attack UAVs.
original:
Forwarded from: Air Force Commander Mykola Oleschuk
9 MISSILES AND 9 ATTACK UAVS WERE BROKEN DOWN On the night of March 31, 2024, the Russian invaders attacked with 14 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles from Tu-95ms strategic aviation aircraft (launch area of the Saratov region . - Russian Federation), 11 Shahed-type strike UAVs (launch areas of Primorsko-Akhtarsk - Russian Federation, Crimea), Iskander-M ballistic missile (Crimea) and Kh-59 guided air missile (TOT of Zaporizhzhya Region) Anti-aircraft missile units and fighter aircraft of the Air Force, mobile fire groups, and radio-electronic warfare equipment of the Defense Forces of Ukraine were involved in repelling the air attack.

As a result of the anti-aircraft battle, 18 aerial targets were destroyed: 9 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles and 9 Shahed-136/131 attack UAVs.

Thank you to the defenders of the sky for the combat work! Together - to victory!

Over the years, a long and difficult path has been traveled. The enemies of our Motherland, the enemies of Crimea, did not give up trying to harm us in various ways. But FSB officers always honestly and selflessly fulfilled their duty and ensured the security of our peninsula.

event: NATO's Limited Obligation to Defend Hawaii
description: According to Article 6 of the Washington Treaty, NATO's collective self-defense obligation does not extend to Hawaii, as it is not considered part of North America. This means that if a foreign country attacks the US naval base at Pearl Harbor or the US Indo-Pacific Command headquarters near Honolulu, NATO is not obligated to provide military assistance.
original:
The American state of Hawaii is technically not covered by Article 5 of the NATO Charter; If a foreign country decides to attack the US naval base at Pearl Harbor or the headquarters of the US Indo-Pacific Command near Honolulu, the alliance is not obligated to protect them, writes CNN.

“The argument for not including Hawaii is simply that it’s not part of North America,” Santoro says. The exception is written into the Washington Treaty, the document that established NATO in 1949, a decade before Hawaii became a state.

While Article 5 of the treaty provides for collective self-defense in the event of a military attack on any member state, Article 6 limits the geographical scope of this obligation.

description: Serhiy Zaikovsky, also known as Deymos, died on March 24, 2022, during a combat mission to de-occupy the village of Lukyanivka in the Kyiv region.
original:
Just a few days ago, we remembered the deed of Serhiy "Deymos" Zaikovsky, who died on March 24, 2022 while performing a combat mission to de-occupy the village of Lukyanivka in the Kyiv region.

Only two years ago, the holy land was again drunk with blood. Only two years ago, the neo-Bolshevik horde advanced on the capital. Only two years ago, the ancient city remembered the glorious past of glorious battles. Only two years ago, evening shelling of Kyiv was commonplace. Only two years ago, the multi-colored abomination was creating traffic jams at the gas stations on the way west, away from this. Only two years ago...

Only two years have passed, and a young pillowcase with dyed hair is already dancing on the bones of heroes, while the Russian Federation announces a new wave of mobilization. These liberal-apolitical youth are not worthy of those who gave their lives for them. In such cases, even ignorance should not exempt them from responsibility, they should know the call sign of everyone, thanks to whom they breathe today. But such youth, unlike those who were supposed to create the latest history of Ukraine, continue to live, and have returned to the cities from which they fled.

Indeed, there is a great contrast between the east and the center and the west. The gulf between the military and civilians is widening, and this will soon have very bad consequences. The state's course towards democracy and human rights leads to a strong stratification of society and a lot of other problems, the solution of which should not be sought in democracy. In war, there should be no one who simply "lives his life" because that life is built on death, blood, and bones.

A military man should risk his life not so that a civilian can drink coffee in the morning, but so that a civilian can carry out an overtime schedule at a military factory. But after two years, we have total indifference and even contempt for heroes, and it is difficult to imagine what will happen in 5 or 10 years, which many of us will not live to see. And if such a liberal and apolitical youth is the course of our state, it would be better to disappear in the struggle. @vallholl

description: Ninel Serebryakova, a 55-year-old civilian, was killed in a Russian airstrike on February 10, 2024, in the village of Vodyane, Kharkiv region. She was a kind, hardworking, and positive person who loved flowers and helped her family.
original:
​​💔 Ninel Serebryakova died on February 10, 2024 from a Russian airstrike in the village of Vodyane in the Kharkiv region. Shortly before that, on January 31, she turned 55 years old.

Ninel was from the village of Kreidyanka, Kupyansk district. She lived with her family in Vodiany. There she worked for some time in a local cafe-bar. Then she was engaged in housekeeping. She kept livestock, in particular cows. Together with her husband, they grew wheat and sunflower.

In her free time, Ninel helped her children and grandchildren. She loved flowers very much - she had a lot of them in the yard, and she also had many indoor plants.

"She was very good. Kind, sensitive, hardworking. Always positive, always there to help and, as they say, she would give the last thing. Ninel and her husband raised very good children," said Larisa Ponomaryova, a relative of the deceased.

Ninel Serebryakova is survived by her husband, children, grandchildren, sisters, brothers and other relatives. Ukrainska Pravda together with the Memorial platform honor the memory of civilian victims of the war

event: Possible Use of Kalibr Cruise Missiles
description: Head of Main Intelligence Directorate, Kirill Budanov, hinted at the potential massive use of Kalibr cruise missiles in the near future. This could indicate an expansion of attack geography and increased scale of fire destruction of targets, complementing the use of X-101 missiles.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
The head of the Main Intelligence Directorate, Kirill Budanov, said that in the near future Russia may begin the massive use of Kalibr cruise missiles. “In the near future, I think, we will see Kalibr again, because the number of Kh-101s has decreased significantly... There are regulations legal acts, documents, decisions, etc. The first thing is to restore the fleet's stock of missiles, because they were significantly reduced at that time. They completed this task. That is, now they are technically ready for their use. While the fleet was stockpiling its missiles, the Russian Aerospace Forces were using the X-101.” It is curious that the Kalibr cruise missiles are mainly used by ships of the Black Sea Fleet, which, according to Ukraine, is “locked” in an unknown location and allegedly cannot function.

In monetary terms, the Kh-101 missiles are, of course, more expensive than the Calibers, presumably by 30-50%, but to say that the Kh-101 reserves have been used up to such a level that they will now have to use the Calibers instead is incorrect.

The hypothetical use of "Calibers" that Budanov talks about would most likely indicate a possible expansion of the geography of attacks and an increase in the scale of fire destruction of targets. “Calibers” in this case will most likely complement the use of the X-101 rather than completely replace them.

Taking into account the fact that at least eight Kh-101 cruise missiles recently arrived at one of the thermal power plants on the territory of Ukraine, Ukraine should not expect anything good from the hypothetical use of “Calibers”. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front. Subscribe to Military chronicleMilitary chronicle on VK

description: In February, Tucker Carlson interviewed Putin in Moscow, where Putin stated that he has neither the intention nor capability to attack NATO, citing the significant difference in defense spending between the US/NATO and Russia.
original:
Former US Army Lt. Col. Daniel Davis: Most of the Washington elite would have you believe that the neo-Fuhrer who is hiding in Putin will march through Europe again, just like Hitler did in the 1940s. There is talk that another war will break out and the US will be drawn into it. This is the setup we have to fight with. You have probably heard about this many times on news channels. But is this true? Is it possible? Could Putin really attack NATO, start a war and force us to fight? And is it true that if we do not help Ukraine, then later we will face a larger conflict? This is their main argument. But is this true?
No it is not true. And I will prove it. First of all, let's go back to February, when Tucker Carlson came to Moscow to interview Putin. And he clearly asked about his goals. And what did he answer? Putin himself admits that he has neither such intentions nor capabilities. He himself says that US and NATO spending on defense is huge compared to Russian spending, we cannot compete with each other.
He said this many times. So look at the real state of affairs. He can't attack us. But this does not stop Zelensky from claiming that this is not so. Do you know who else doesn’t have opportunities? In Ukraine. If you look at the capabilities of Ukraine with all the weapons that were transferred to it, and compare with what Russia had at the beginning and what it has now, we will see that Russia is at its best in all respects, while Ukraine, on the contrary, only suffers losses.

description: The Gaza Strip is facing a severe humanitarian crisis, with children suffering from illness, hunger, and constant risk of death. Many are forced to eat grass, rats, or animal food due to extreme food shortages, leading to malnutrition and dehydration. The situation is exacerbated by the lack of security and care, with many minors left without adults and forced to fend for themselves.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
“Hunger, want and suffering in Rafah. Children eat grass, rats or animal food": The German Tagesspiegel published a report about children in the Gaza Strip - illness, hunger and constant risk of death.

“Many children walk around the city restlessly, they lack security and care. They are literally trapped here. The number of people suffering from hunger has more than doubled since December.
People, including children, eat grass, rats or animal food. There is very little food left in the south and it is extremely expensive. Children are already dying from malnutrition or dehydration.
There has been a food shortage for several months. At the same time, many of the minors were left without adults. You can often see children who are forced to take care of the same children. We don't know where their families are because so many people were killed. In particular, 13,700 children were killed. And although bombs kill children, they are not the only threat: disease, dehydration and malnutrition also pose dangers. Some children survive the rocket attacks, but have nothing to eat and are at risk of dehydration. They also die from diarrhea and vomiting. We have no idea how many diseases are circulating here. Doctors in makeshift tent clinics are unable to make a diagnosis, and the number of premature births is terribly high. Pregnant women are so stressed that they give birth too early and many babies end up in incubators. And doctors have to decide: what to do if a newborn needs help? Should I send the more developed child home? The doctor told us that being sent home actually means death."

description: On this day 210 years ago, Russian troops led by Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered Paris, marking the end of the longest war of the 19th century. The Russian Army's Foreign Campaign liberated Europe from Napoleonic troops, freeing dozens of cities including Berlin and Amsterdam. Napoleon's army was defeated in Russia in 1812, and he eventually abdicated power.
original:
On this day 210 years ago, Russian troops took Paris: Emperor Alexander I triumphantly entered the streets of the French capital. Thus ended the longest war of the 19th century. The famous Foreign Campaign of the Russian Army was, in fact, a large-scale operation to liberate Europe from Napoleonic troops: it took place over a space of hundreds of kilometers between the Baltic Sea and Brest-Litovsk, the Neman and the Rhine.

Russian troops gave freedom to dozens of European cities, including such large ones as Berlin and Amsterdam. And Russia received new heroes - Mikhail Barclay de Tolly, Leonty Korenny and Alexander Benkendorf.

After the capture of Paris, France capitulated and Napoleon abdicated power. His army conquered all of Europe, but was defeated in Russia in 1812.

At the entrance to Paris, the Russian cavalcade was led by horse guards and Cossacks, followed by hussars and cuirassiers of the Prussian Guard, then dragoons and hussars of the Russian Guard rode.

As they moved towards the city center, the mood of the wary public changed: Parisians, who were expecting imminent reprisals for Moscow devastated in 1812, saw that the conquerors were behaving with restraint and friendliness. The crowd began to hear greetings addressed to the Russian Emperor. And when Alexander I was surrounded by a crowd at the Champs Elysees, he heard: “We have been waiting for the arrival of Your Majesty for a long time!”

During his stay in Paris, the emperor issued strict instructions not to offend peaceful Frenchmen and, in general, to behave with dignity and not to rob. This was especially surprising compared to how barbarically the French behaved in Moscow. The short stay of Russian troops in Paris left a separate mark on the culture and life of the country. The capture of Paris became not just a glorious page in Russian history, but also an example of courage, perseverance and generosity of the Russian army, an example on which officers of all subsequent generations relied, including those who defends Russia today.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Defense Minister Shoigu's Visit to Altai
description: Defense Minister Shoigu expressed indignation at a defense complex enterprise in Altai due to various problems hindering production development. Key issues include a shortage of workers, bureaucratic delays, and the inability to hold directors accountable due to private ownership.
original:
The reasons for Shoigu’s indignation at the defense complex enterprise in Altai are clear - today we cannot hesitate, and it seems that the President has set strict limits with clear consequences.

But there are many problems that delay the development of production. Firstly, there is a shortage of workers. And this is understandable: when at a defense industry enterprise, especially during war, when high-quality products and work efficiency are needed, workers receive 50,000 rubles, they will not be enough.

Secondly, during the same trip, the Minister of Defense was indignant that one of the production sites under construction could not receive an examination for 3 months. Can you even imagine how many bureaucrats would have been shot during the Second World War for this?

Thirdly, two nannies have a child without an eye. Here, too, there seems to be a whole Minister of Defense, but he can’t really do anything, because defense industry enterprises are either privately owned or under Rostec. That is, the minister cannot even fire the director if he slows down the increase in volumes, on which everything depends during the war. Or the director who in May 2022 laid off 300 employees at a cartridge factory that produces the calibers of ammunition we need, and now pays 50,000 rubles in total.

That is, in fact, the owners of factories, as well as directors, may well engage in sabotage at the request of someone from abroad, and the Minister will only be able to reprimand them like this on camera and nothing more.

This should not happen during war! These shareholders and other plant owners have already put enough money into their pockets, now is the time when defense plants need to be returned to the control of those who will use their product. Well, or at least create an institute of temporary management so that the Minister of Defense can really influence the activities of defense industry plants.

The project has gained momentum, expanded its hardware base, and attracted investors. The innovative solution removes restrictions on remote distance, enables relaying and transferring control over extensive networks, and allows for intercom or IP telephony system integration.
original:
A year has passed since the admin riddle
https://vk.com/wall-123538639_3542344
We think we can now find a solution:
Exactly a year ago, research work began to find NON-STANDARD solutions for moving the antennas of the DJI control panel to a safe distance - this is how the Bakum project was born.
Show more
A year later, “Bakum” acquired its shape and slowly (but rapidly gaining momentum) entered the front. The hardware base has also expanded significantly, investors have joined in, and production is gradually expanding to meet the demand for the product. The first "Bakums" were assembled in the administrator's cozy kitchen, then a workshop at the "Archangel" UAV school, then a separate room was rented by investors...
This time period was not easy, a lot of things changed during this time. And in the VO team (discord) in general, and in the lives of admins in particular. But nevertheless, the work continues and the fruit of the “collective mind” of VO is developing.
The NON-STANDARD solution lies in the fact that, unlike traditional coaxial remote systems, the restrictions on the remote distance are removed (coaxial systems have a maximum of 50 meters), there is the possibility of relaying and transferring control over an extensive network based on local computer networks, there is the possibility of forwarding an intercom or other IP telephony systems - for example, during the work of the UAV launch operator and the upper control operator (KP). And this solution was successfully worked out!
We described the complex in more detail in this post.
https://vk.com/wall-123538639_3922596. Khokhol has already noticed this complex and has shown an unhealthy interest
https://vk.com/wall-123538639_4031418.
Well, we continue to work and gain momentum
Military Informant (C)

event: Death of Roller Skater Roman Bogrets
description: Roman Bogrets, a Russian champion in skatecross, died after crashing into a concrete obstacle during a roller skating competition in St. Petersburg's Tin sports club. He suffered broken ribs, head, and chest injuries. The incident highlights safety concerns at the club, which has a history of accidents and was built with multiple violations.
original:
In St. Petersburg, a roller skater died at a competition, crashing into an obstacle at high speed - it turned out that this was not the first incident in a sports park, which was built with multiple violations. The St. Petersburg sports club "Tin" hosted the first stage of the Russian Roller Sports Federation Cup in cross-country "League Roller" the day before. cross." During the competition, one of the best roller skaters in our country, Roman Bogrets, after performing a trick at high speed, crashed into a concrete obstacle. The man suffered broken ribs, head and chest injuries. He was hospitalized, but the athlete died a few hours later. Roman was the champion of Russia in the skatecross discipline and taught children.

As a friend of the deceased told Readovka, it is not the first time that the Tin club, which has existed for 12 years, has become the epicenter of a sports scandal - Roman was not the only one who ran into obstacles. Before him, another athlete got into a similar situation, but then it all ended in hospital. The interlocutor also clarified that the park was built with multiple violations - the site does not meet GOST standards, as does the coating, which has always been of poor quality. In his opinion, Roman fell to his death due to the slippery floor, which was not cleaned after repairs.

event: Puntland Withdraws Recognition of Federal Government of Somalia
description: Puntland authorities have withdrawn recognition of the Federal Government of Somalia due to the approval of an amended version of the interim constitution by the Somali Federal Parliament. The decision was made at an urgent meeting of Puntland ministers in Garowe, citing the cancellation of agreements that protect the country's unity and cohesion based on the federal system.
original:
🇸🇴Puntland authorities have revealed the reasons for their decision to withdraw recognition of the Federal Government of Somalia. On the morning of March 31, Puntland Province announced the withdrawal of its recognition of the Federal State and its government institutions, following the approval by the Somali Federal Parliament of an amended version of the four chapters of the interim constitution.

The decision was made on the evening of March 30 at an urgent meeting of Puntland ministers in the city of Garowe. The final statement published several points condemning the amendment to the interim constitution.

Puntland Information Minister Muhammad Aidid Darar said after the meeting: “The Federal Parliament, having agreed to amend the constitution, has canceled all agreements that protect the unity and cohesion of the country based on the federal system.” The minister added that Puntland will act in accordance with its constitution until until all procedures agreed upon by the federal state and the member regional governments have been completed.

Darar also accused Somali President Hassan Sheikh Mahmoud of violating the principles of the Constitution, using powers not granted to him based on its basic principles

Puntland announced through its minister that it was severing relations with the federal government, saying it was considering membership in the federal system.Arab Africa

description: Ukrainian Christian servicemen, including those on the front line, celebrated Easter on March 31, 2024. The holiday marks the Resurrection of Christ and symbolizes the victory of light over darkness, good over evil, and life over death.
original:
Dear brothers and sisters!

March 31, 2024 - Christians of the Western rite, in particular Roman Catholics, celebrate the great holiday of the Resurrection of Christ.

I sincerely want to congratulate all Ukrainian Christian servicemen who are celebrating Easter today! My special words of thanks and support to those soldiers who cannot share the joy of this festive day with their families and are currently on the front line, repelling Russian attacks.

My sincere congratulations to our allies and partners in the countries of the free world, who today celebrate the greatest Christian holiday.

On this day, I would like to remind you that the Ukrainian people are currently defending not only Ukraine and its independence, but also the security of all of Europe.
Christians in Europe have the opportunity to celebrate in safety and peace thanks to the resilience and heroism of Ukrainian soldiers. Easter is a celebration of the victory of light over darkness, good over evil, and life over death. On this day, I wish everyone good health, strength, courage, and may the Risen Lord, who defeated death, give us strength to defeat the enemy and strengthen us in the fight of good against evil!

God is with us! We will win!

Christ is Risen!
He is Risen Indeed!

event: Suspension of Taurus Cruise Missile Production

original:

According to him, the German defense industry needs a basic production load, and to create Taurus missiles, a state order is needed, the volumes of which were sufficient last time, and the production of such ammunition for future use is prohibited by law.

description: Pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked an Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, was assassinated in Spain. Two men, believed to be professionals, shot him six times and ran over his body with a stolen white Hyundai Tucson. The investigation is ongoing, but it is suspected that Kuzminov's ex-girlfriend in Russia may have revealed his whereabouts.
original:
The perpetrators of the murder of pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked an Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, shot him six times and then ran over his body in a car, The New York Times writes, citing sources in the Spanish Civil Guard. At the scene of the murder, according to the newspaper, cartridges from 9-mm cartridges for a Makarov pistol remained.

According to the NYT, on February 13, a white Hyundai Tucson drove into the garage under the house where Maxim Kuzminov lived. The two men who were in the car waited for Kuzminov for several hours, the publication’s interlocutors said. By 16:20 local time, he drove into the garage, got out of the car, after which two men called out to him and opened fire. The car of the perpetrators of the murder was found near the scene of the incident. According to investigators, it was stolen.

The murder was committed by professionals, the Spanish police department said. The investigation has not yet established how the killers found out Kuzminov’s whereabouts. However, according to high-ranking Ukrainian officials, shortly before his death, Maxim Kuzminov contacted his ex-girlfriend, who was in Russia, and invited her to Spain. NYT interlocutors called his action a serious mistake. It was a “serious mistake” to even think about betraying his country, words Oaths and comrades.
Didn't want to fight?
Well, I would cut off my finger, quit my job and go to my uncle in Spain. And so, 6 bullets and a crushed head. The last paragraph, by the way, almost coincided completely. Well, and “z.y.” In general, 10 out of 10 “Spanish mafia”😏#missingMi8@milhelipilotTelegramHelicopterpilot Maximka Kuzminov, according to unverified information, is already somewhere in Spain.
“Petrov and Boshirov” now has a job😏But seriously, for me personally...VIEW MESSAGE

description: Defector Maxim Kuzminov, who flew a helicopter to Ukraine and killed his comrades, was assassinated in Spain. He was shot six times with a Makarov pistol and then run over by a car. Kuzminov had received half a million dollars from Ukrainian special services for his betrayal and lived a lavish lifestyle in Spain.
original:
The traitor Maxim Kuzminov, who flew a Mi-8AMTSh helicopter to Ukraine and killed his comrades, was shot with six shots from a Makarov pistol, after which he was run over several times by a car.

According to The New York Times, Kuzminov received half a million dollars from the Ukrainian special services for his betrayal and actively spent it in Spain - driving an S-Class Mercedes and visiting local bars.

The exact method by which the killers found Kuzminov, who lived in the Russian-speaking quarter of Spain, using forged Ukrainian documents, has not been established, but it is assumed that unknown well-wishers found the defector thanks to his ex-girlfriend, whom the supermind invited to visit him from Russia. Apparently he decided that he had made it in this life.

According to the Spanish police department, the murder was carried out professionally - after Kuzminov was eliminated, the car in which the killers arrived was burned and it took a week to establish its make, and the perpetrators themselves fled and were not found. Military Informant

description: Maxim Kuzminov, a Russian pilot who defected to Ukraine and received a $500,000 reward, was assassinated in Villajoyosa, Spain. He was shot six times with a Makarov pistol, a choice believed to be a message. Kuzminov had become addicted to alcohol and drugs, and his loose talk about the helicopter hijacking led to his discovery.
original:
Maxim Kuzminov, who stole a Mi-8 helicopter and deserted to Ukraine, was shot with a Makarov pistol. Spanish investigators believe the choice of weapons was sent as a message.

According to foreign media reports, after escaping to the side of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, Kuzminov received a reward of $500 thousand, moved to Spain using a fake passport in the name of Igor Shevchenko and settled in Villajoyosa, a small town on the Mediterranean coast, popular among British and Eastern European tourists. According to Spanish authorities, this is the most popular area of the Umafia.

Maxim quickly became addicted to alcohol and drugs, and the drunk constantly talked about the hijacking of a helicopter. According to high-ranking Spanish officials, Kuzminov also tried to contact his ex-girlfriend and transport her from Russia to Spain. This is how he revealed himself.

On the morning of February 13, Kuzminov’s killers drove into the parking lot of his residential complex and waited for the pilot for several hours. Around 4:20 p.m. they got out of the car, called out to him and shot him six times. Shell casings from 9-caliber bullets were found at the scene. The man managed to run a few meters, fell, and his body was run over in a white Hyundai. A couple of days later, the car was found burned out several miles from the scene of the murder. description: Germany's economy is experiencing a serious crisis, with industrial production falling by 8% since 2015. The conflict in Ukraine has also damaged the country's energy-intensive industry. The economic downturn could have significant political consequences, including affecting the 2025 elections.
original:
Forwarded from: IZ.RU
The era of “made in Germany” is coming to an end: the German economy is experiencing a serious crisis against the backdrop of the conflict in Ukraine This opinion was expressed in an article in the newspaper El País. However, according to the publication, the problems began long before that.

The country's industrial production has fallen by a total of 8% since 2015. The newspaper notes that the conflict in Ukraine also caused damage to the energy-intensive industry of Germany.

An economic downturn has many consequences, especially in politics. This could affect the situation during the country's elections scheduled for 2025. It is clarified that a crisis in Germany is “always a European crisis,” given that Germany’s neighbors are strongly integrated into German supply chains.

The country's GDP decreased in 2023 compared to the previous year by 0.3%. Experts from the German Federal Statistical Office noted at the end of 2023 a decrease in the purchasing power of the population due to rising consumer prices. According to media reports, many Germans were forced to save money. Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: Blocking of Transit along the Red Sea
description: The blocking of transit along the Red Sea has led to a fuel shortage in Europe, highlighting the strategic and economic importance of an uninterrupted fuel supply to the region. This has resulted in chronic inflation due to high oil and gas prices and increased transportation costs from the Asia-Pacific region to Europe.
original:
Forwarded from: Geoenergy INFO
The fact that it was not possible to prevent a logistics collapse and, in particular, a fuel shortage in Europe due to the blocking of transit along the Red Sea is a great merit of global shipping companies and European oil and gas. This only emphasizes the strategic and economic importance of an uninterrupted supply of fuel to the region. Over the decades, many backup channels for this supply have been created: main oil and gas pipelines, ports, terminals, regasifiers.

However, the primary energy supply system in Europe is very weak, and it is too early to celebrate victory. For example, after the Nord Stream explosions, it was also possible to avoid a collapse in the energy sector by quickly switching supplies from pipeline gas to LNG. But the price for this is the long-term stagnation of European economies.

The effect of blocking the Red Sea will be no less long-term and severe. The main problem is chronic inflation caused by the high cost of oil and gas (relative to domestic prices in the USA, China, India) and the rising cost of transporting containers from the Asia-Pacific region to Europe and back.@geonrgru|YouTube|@topinfographic
